TO AMEND H.J. RES. 147 (12/22/1931), AUTHORIZING THE POSTPONEMENT OF AMOUNTS PAYABLE TO THE UNITED STATES FROM FOREIGN GOVERNMENTS DURING THE FISCAL YEAR 1932 AND THEIR REPAYMENT OVER A TEN YEAR PERIOD, BEGINNING JULY 1, 1933, BY PROVIDING THAT NO AGREEMNTS BE MADE WITH ANY GOVERNMENTS UNLESS THEY ASSENT IN A FORM AND MANNER SATISFACTORY TO THE PRESIDENT TO THE CHANGING OF THE TREATY OF VERSAILLES AND THE RETURN TO GERMANY OF HER COLONIES

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 147, BY PROVIDING THAT NO POSTPONEMENT OF DEBTS OF FOREIGN GOVERNMENTS SHALL BE CONSIDERED UNLESS THEY AGREE TO THE CHANGING OF THE TREATY OF VERSAILLES IN A FORM AND MANNER SATISFACTORY TO THE PRESIDENT. (P. 1119-1)
TO AMEND H.J. RES. 147, BY DEFINING "REPARATIONS" AS USED IN THIS SECTION TO MEAN "CONDITIONAL AND UNCONDITIONAL REPARATIONS."  (P. 1120-1)

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 147, BY PERMITTING THE FEDERAL LAND BANKS TO ENTER INTO AGREEMENTS WITH BORROWERS TO POSTPONE PAYMENTS ON THE SAME BASIS ALLOWED TO FOREIGN GOVERNMENTS AS PROVIDED UNDER THIS BILL.  (P. 1120-2)

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 147, BY PROVIDING THAT THE UNITED STATES WILL NOT PERMIT ITSELF TO BE REGARDED AS AQUIESCING IN A CHANGE IN THE TREATY OF VERSAILLES TO THE EFFECT THAT GERMANY ALONE WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE WAR TERMINATED BY THE TREATY.  (P. 1125-2)
TO PASS H.J. RES. 147.  (P. 1071-2)

TO AMEND H.C. RES. 5, PROVIDING THAT THE TWO HOUSES ADJOURN ON TUESDAY DEC. 22, 1931 UNTIL 12 O'CLOCK NOON, MONDAY JAN. 4, 1932, BY PROVIDING THAT ADJOURNMENT SHALL BE UNTIL DEC. 28, 1931, INSTEAD OF JAN. 4, 1932.  (P. 1130-1)
